Reviews.Title: Impressed.  Great Value.
Reviews.Author: btn1100
Reviews.Content: Overview:The S3200 has a DSLR style body that is very comfortable to hold on to.  This camera has a 14MP CCD sensor, an excellent 24x zoom(24-576mm equivalent on a 35mm camera), A very nice 3" LCD, Electronic Viewfinder, 720p video and ISO up to 6400(not that you really want to use it, more on that later)Ergonomics / Ease of Use:The menu system on the Finepix cameras are very nice and the buttons on the S3200 are nicely placed.  It has a nice grip around the lens and it would have been nice if that could have been incorporated as a zoom ring.Image Quality:From ISO 64-200, the pictures are very sharp with excellent color.  From ISO 400-800, the pictures are still sharp with nice color but signs of noise and the effects of noise reduction are noticeable if you start to pixel peep.  I would say these shots certainly are still capable of being printed at 5x7 and being used on the web with no issues.ISO 1600 - ISO 6400(ISO 3200 and 6400 can only be used with reduced MP resolution) I would only use this to make sure I could get the shot if that was the only option due to discoloration, smearing and loss of detail. This is very common across all smaller sensor cameras.Conclusion:This is an excellent bridge camera that takes sharp pictures with nice color.  I would highly recommend this camera to friends and family, the key litmus test in my mindRatings:Design/Ergonomics - 4.5Features - 4.5Image Quality - 4Value - 5Ease Of Use - 5Positives:24x Zoom - Nice color - Sharp images - Great Battery Life.Negatives:Noisy and loss of detail at higher ISO settings

Reviews.Title: Wanna be photographer
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Yeager "lizzytish"
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera wanted to upgrade from my point and shoot but wasn't ready to take the step to DSLR since I have absolutely NO experience with cameras other than turning them on and pointing them at the subject I'm interested in photographing and pushing a button.  So I was searching something that had the options of me setting aperture and shutter speed when and if I eventually figure out how to use that option but still gave me an option of just pointing and shooting which is what I do best.  I also was looking for something in my price range.  This camera fit all these and more and I gotta tell ya I'm not let down one bit.  This is a great camera for those like me that wish they knew what they were doing when it comes to photography.  It has many tools to help you frame that perfect picture, get the lighting right etc.  I can't wait to travel more with this camera especially with the panorama mode. I bought it as a package deal through a BJs club membership with memory card and case for only $180 which I think was an amazing deal and just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: D. Brooks "Cardinals fan"
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera and was looking for one with a nice zoom and view finder for an upcoming trip.The zoom is great for this price range.  You can use the view finder or the nice sizable screen.  I find the view finder much easier in centering my subjects.  I enjoyed the 4-AA batteries and gives me the assurance my camera won't die without having to recharge a lithium type battery.The size is manageable.  You cannot stick it in your pocket naturally but it is not really that bulky.In my limited use, the clarity of photos have been nothing short of perfect clear shots.  I'm still learning all the features packed in this well priced camera and look forward to seeing what all it can really do.I'm not a big camera buff.  I found the camera quite easy to use though had a little trouble in the on/off switch.  I was holding it over too long and learned it takes just a quick flip to start it.

Reviews.Title: It's not a Canon Eos, get over it.
Reviews.Author: Peter Mckay "Fresno Pete"
Reviews.Content: As someone who grew up with a fully manual Yashica FX-2 film camera, and who had to give it up after 30 years use for a (the horror) point-and-shoot (albeit a Canon Powershot A1000 IS) I was hesitant to even get an entry level DSLR, which is what this camera is. I read all the reviews, especially the 1 and 2 stars by people who evidently have no clue about how to operate anything but a point-and-shoot. So here's the non-professional-but-I-know-a-few-things-about-cameras review.This is a very well featured DSLR, not a point and shoot, you have to know how to use the settings and features to get the pictures you want. If you want simple, then the above mentioned Canon Powershot A1000 IS is highly recommended. If you want something other than a cookie cutter approach to photography, READ THE DANG MANUAL. I've had mine for 2 weeks, used every single feature at least once, had zero problems once I got used to how to set up for the picture and actually found enjoyment in  photography again. I don't know what some people expect, this is not a $500 Canon Eos, but I have yet to have the problems that the 1 and 2 star people have experienced. Spend some time (at least 2 hours) with the manual in a park learning each setting, get to know what it's capable of, you will be less disappointed when it comes time to tune in a picture by memory.About the only suggestion I have is to get the Class 4 8gb card, I found especially in mixing HD video clips and pictures on the 10 to 14mp settings you fill up that 4gb card pretty quickly. On a recent trip to San Francisco I got about 12 minutes of good HD video and 426 mixed 10, 12 and 14mp pictures and still had some room left on the 8 gig card.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Bridge Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent bridge camera that takes sharp pictures with nice color.  I have read some of the negative reviews and I am not sure how they came to those conclusions.  Is it as good as my DSLR?... No.  My DLSR cost me $900.00 more than this camera.  Does it take great pics for being point and shoot superzoom?... YES.  I have posted a number of pics that I took with this camera here on Amazon if you would like to review.(I think it shows up under the name Brian)Pros:Excellent range(24x)Nice colorSharp images ISO 400 and belowExcellent HD VideoFeature richGreat Battery LifeCons:Noisy and loss of detail at higher ISO settings(like ALL smaller sensor cameras)Power on to "ready to shoot time" is very slow(just let it go into power save mode and don't turn it off when you are out for a day of shooting)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Focusing Slightly Off
Reviews.Author: Mp3 Player Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a few days ago. I have taken lots of pictures with it already, and have gotten a feel for how it works.The Good:- Image Stabilization. I thought it worked very well, and what Fuji says about it working great at full zoom is very true I have found.- Electronic Viewfinder. I think looks are misleading on this one, because it does look funky in the pictures. But the viewfinder is really big, which is a huge plus for me.- Black and White. I know this sounds wierd, but some cameras do have bad black and white settings. The metering is off and such. But this one did surprisingly well.- The Zoom. On some cameras you can only zoom in to 1x, 2x, etc. On this camera you can zoom in at 1.0x, 1.2x, 1.4x, etc. Really great for getting the perfect picture.- The Metering. Did a really great job with this. The colors were well balanced.- Colors. Colors were all true, especially in the dark reds/deep purples, even though most point-and-shoots have trouble with this.- Image Quality. I really thought it did a nice job with the pictures. Outside, they were noise-free.- The SR Auto and Auto modes. I am an experienced photographer, and I set it on Auto most of the time just because the camera did it just as well as I could have myself.The Evil:- Low-Light. Every camera has a problem with this, but this one really had some noisy images in low-light conditions. Not an ideal camera for this, but I did most of my photography outside, so it was okay with me.- Slow Focusing. Especially while zooming, the focus could be really slow.- Dial. Most cameras have a dial, and this one did, but it didn't have what you would think it would have on the dial. It had Auto, SR Auto, P, S, A, M, Panoramic, SP, and Movie Modes. No Macro or Portrait there, you have to go to a separate menu for that.- Zoom Ring. Well, there isn't one. It looks like there is one, but there isn't. It would have been a nice addition, especially considering it looks like its there.Overall, I think this camera was a great purchase, especially considering the price. The image quality is not SLR-standard, but that is probably because...its not an SLR!

Reviews.Title: Wow, what a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Linda Hensens "ADD Diva"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a great camera for a long time, and I finally found it with this camera. It meets all of my needs. I am not a professional photographer. I am one that loves to take impromptu pictures of nature and/or other things that surround me totally on the fly. I love the stability feature on this camera, which means that I can be driving in the NC mountains, see a beauty shot, stick my camera out of my window and snap the shot. It comes out crystal clear with NO issues. No more red eye for my pet pictures, either! I love that I don't have to frame the picture or take too much time figuring out the lighting, etc. I just snap away and decide what to keep later. Love, love, love it!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Grant
Reviews.Content: Just received the Fuji S3200.  Takes great photos.  Using the flower mode today to take pictures of all my peonies, they came out spectacular, down to the fuzz on the bee that was collecting pollen.  Eager to try out the other features.  Good camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: A GEM right out of the box!!!
Reviews.Author: Jay Slowiak
Reviews.Content: Update:  It has been 3 months owning this camera and I have never been happier about owning a piece of technology.. It has taken almost no bad shots and lets face it, there is no way any camera is going to take a great picture 100 percent of the time right so why the bad reviews? Ive read them and cannot understand how this camera is not treasured especially for the price..I've gotten so many compliments on my photography because of this camera it's starting to make me wonder if I should be a photographer lol...Seriously though, some of these reviews must be from people who do not know how to operate the camera. For instance my girlfriend tries to take pictures and then immediately gives it back and says you can take better ones..I keep telling her to gently push down the capture button slightly, hold it, then it will focus on what your looking at, after this is done then you push it down the rest of the way after it's focused to take the picture(Hold it steady)...This camera has a 2 step capture, if you just push the button down you will get a bad shot because it's not focused plus it has many many different auto settings like sr auto which will take better shots than normal capture mode...Plus the list of functions on this baby is so long that if your not in the right mode in the right lighting it will take a bad picture...For me it takes wonderful pictures, Ive taken a picture of my daughter in her baby swing while it was swinging on setting 4 which at that point I have to time the shot so I get her in view....BING!!! absolutely clear picture on a moving target!!So how can it take that bad a pictures for so many people? I think the instructions would be a great place to start looking then....Or the cd that also comes with it to tell you how to work the functions that are not in the manual...First posting:  I was looking for something to take the precious moments of our newborns life in photography and video...We searched and we thought we would take a shot at this finepix s3200 and well after spotting many others we are very happy with our choice...I am an amateur at this but This camera is the best I've ever owned, Right out of the box it has settings for everything with night and day settings, face capture, stabalized for movement and it also has aiuto red eye detect...Not to mention the zoom is absolutely great... I caught a single corn stalk over the top of the field and it zoned in on that one stalk and blurred the rest out for one of the best shots i've ever taken....Not to mention the pure fact that this camera for us normal people is the right choice just for the simple fact that it takes perfect pictures indoors and at night! The flash is marvelous and it gives the photo the look of being taken during the day...You cant go wrong, batteries, neckstrap, and lens cap included with all box and packaging factory brand new!

Reviews.Title: as bad as they said
Reviews.Author: Reds
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this camera -- easy to grip, clear controls, great framing and focusing features, viewfinder, price -- except that it takes miserably awful photos.  I really wanted to keep this camera and tried in every light and setting, re-read the manual and tried again.  All my photos came out like paint-by-number cartoons.  None of that stunning detail I got from my basic 8-year-old  point-and-shoot the FinePix was supposed to replace.Camera-makers, it's not about the pixel count or spy-level zoom.  The goal is clear pictures.  And for crying out loud, we want viewfinders.  I plan to take photos in bright sunlight where even the best LCD pales below usability.I'm now without a working camera and would be grateful for a recommendation of a solid, easy-to-grip camera with a viewfinder -- but please not Olympus which gives me the option of buying a flimsy plastic add-on viewfinder for a ridiculous $200, or Nikon Coolpix P7000 with its tiny blurry toy viewfinder.I am grateful for Amazon's easy return process. That would get five stars.

Reviews.Title: Darling_Diana
Reviews.Author: Darling_Diana
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new camera. It is light weight and easy to use. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a step-up camera. My sister saw it and now wants to get one for herself. Everyone in our family has tried the camera and wants one. It's a fun camera, takes great pictures, even if you are an amateur like me...love it!Fujifilm FinePix S3200 14 MP Digital Camera with Fujinon 24x Super Wide Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: excellent value - durable product
Reviews.Author: georgedelnorte
Reviews.Content: The S-3200 has all the features you would expect from a camera priced much higher.  Features are easy to use and logical.  All settings are made with buttons and a wheel rather than touch screen (touch screen can be difficult in bright sun).  Both optical and digital telephoto are excellent.  Macro is supurb.  Because the camera uses AA bateries, it is a bit heavier than other brands that have small - often hard to find - camera batteries.  However, Fuji has a discharge feature that allows you to completely discharge a NiMh battery before recharging, thus extending the capacity of the battery - very good idea.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Larry D. Cassity
Reviews.Content: This a wonderfull all in one camera ! It takes great pictures in the light and the dark. It is VERY simple to use. There is no changeing lense every time you wish to take Wide,Zoom or close up shots. It runs on 4 AA battterys so there is no need for trying to find a camera shop if the battery goes dead. I would recomed this to anyone who likes takeing photos !!!!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Trevor J. Hall
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything.  I bought it originally as a present but I will have to duplicate the purchase.  Apart from a slight, almost imperceptable, pause in the shutter time it is up to all the prpoperties of any digital SLR.With a large sized memory card one can really rock and roll and refine one's technique.  No doubt the Professional photographers of yore went to the best schools and perfected their theory in the classroom..........but methinks that part of polishing their technique was the humungeous quantities of film that we mere mortals could not afford.  Now the digital world can match their unfair advantage and this is the camera to challenge their frontier - with this camera one can start on an artistic path, even by trial and error.

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera for a loved one... if you hate them.
Reviews.Author: Mikell
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fujifilm FinePix s3200 for my wife for Christmas, as she wanted to upgrade from her old 6MP Samsung S630 point-and-shoot, which was never a very good camera anyway. I spent hours and hours reading reviews. (which aren't always the most reliable since any idiot can buy a product, have not the slightest idea what they're doing with it, and leave a bad review for it online) For days I combed the internet for any and all professional reviews and hardware specs on various brands and models, until finally I narrowed it down between the (VERY) few within our price range. I took her to an electronics shop where they had several demos setup to try and she liked the feel of this one, so that was that.Christmas evening we were both excited to try her new camera. Right out of the box we were impressed with the camera's zoom. Sitting directly across a 20ft room you could zoom in on a small tree ornament and get a super-macro quality shot. We were delighted, until she tried taking pictures of ANYTHING ELSE. I have no idea why, but the camera would not take a clear shot of anything. Of course, I tried adjusting the aperture, ISO, scene settings and all modes, but the problems just became worse and worse. We reached the point where almost every photo came out completely out of focus and red-orange and black, which is a defining sign that your aperture should be adjusted... well, even after restoring all settings to default/factory, the issues never subsided. Now, I know what you're thinking! "That sounds ludicrous. It must be a defective camera." I know, which is why I returned that sonnuvabitch for an exact replacement. Same. Damn. Problem.Now, while my wife has what they call "the photographer's eye", she's definitely more of a point-and-shoot kind of person, meaning she wants to see something, point at it, click a button and have a great picture. I, on the other hand have had a bit more experience with the hardware & software of photography. She really wanted to keep this camera and try to troubleshoot it, but I could smell the stench of Fujifilm's bad software in this thing from a mile away, so we returned it a SECOND TIME.Third time's a charm... which is why I said "F*** that!" and bought a Canon Powershot SX40 HS. It was more than double what I paid for the Fujifilm, but as anyone who's ever owned a Canon will tell you, there is no substitute. The Canon SX40 HS is by far the best camera we have ever owned. The photos that we get with the Canon are phenomenal! It is capable of zooming in on the moon and capturing a HAND-HELD shot with NASA-grade accuracy. I cannot say enough good things about her new Canon. Stellar right out of the freaking box.Look, bottom line: Stay the hell away from this Fujifilm S3200. Experienced photographers say it's junk. Novice's say it's junk. I'm telling you it's junk. If you're in the market for a new camera, and willing to drop the coin on one of these mid-step DSLR models anyway, why not save a couple more months and get a Canon? You'll thank me when pictures of your kids don't look like Satan ripping himself into our dimension from the bowels of a hellish pit of torturous fire.Canon SX40 HS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 35x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch Vari-Angle Wide LCD.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Nikki R
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic! It has a lot of features of more expensive, professional models but with complete ease of use. I was able to take great pics right out of the box. And the value was superb! I think this camera is just as good as some of the other cameras out there but for a couple hundred dollars less. The zoom is very good on this model and even at full zoom the image is crisp and clean, not blurry. I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money.
Reviews.Author: Flyer101
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm FinePix S3200 may have some bells and whistles, but it isn't a good camera.  I've put it through a workout over the past two days, taking hundreds of photos in different lighting conditions, and have not been at all pleased with the performance.  The focus is off.  The left third of almost all of my pictures is blurry.  Some shots are entirely blurry, even when using the flash.  I took a picture of my child and while the background 30 feet away was in focus, my son (who was front and center) was not.  Photos are grainy starting at ISO 400.  The panorama feature does not correctly line up the photos.  Some of the panoramas would have been comical, if I hadn't been so disgusted with myself for spending money on this camera.  Forget low-light images -- they're unusable.  My Canon PowerShot S50 is on its last legs, but even it takes better pictures than this one.  I'm very disappointed and will be returning the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera so far
Reviews.Author: ka_002
Reviews.Content: No problems out of the box. Camera fired right up without a problem. Software was easy to load for picture management. The manual is a bit overwhelming 100+ pages, but it is a fairly sophisticated camera, well beyond a typical point and shoot product.Just starting to work with the manaul settings for shutter speed and aperture, but so far it is the closest thing to a SLR I have found without spending a huge amount of money. I would recommend this camera strongly for those wishing to take more manaul control of their picture taking, but don't have the money for a true SLR.

Reviews.Title: Waste Of U.S. Dollars
Reviews.Author: smartshopper
Reviews.Content: Slow Focus Was Similar To Taking APicture In 1869.The Auto Focus was misery.You push the button to take a pictureand count to 5 before it takes it.I was so happy with my Nikon...Nikon is super fast and super slick....I miss my lost money...

Reviews.Title: Impressed by camera
Reviews.Author: Leslie Arthur
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews...I decided to purchase this camera...I am still amaze at the quality of photographs that this camera takes....I am really impressed..

Reviews.Title: Best Cost-Benefit Camera
Reviews.Author: stefano
Reviews.Content: At first i was doubtful about this camera because there was 2 reviews talking about the bad quality of the shots and other aspects that I consider very important, in despite of that i took the decision of buying the camera and I have to say am very very pleased with this article. It has a full customizable mode where you can take pictures adjusting opening speed and other things, obviously its not a professional camera so if you are a professional photographer you should look some other product. But if you are starting with photo and want to experiment with a excellent zoom camera this is your choice, and for the money I think it worth it. So dont be shy, this is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: Damn lens ring
Reviews.Author: Tamudawson
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the actual camera and the working components of it.  Simple to use and a long battery life.  However the largest annoyance is the darn ring that covers the lens, it keeps popping off.

Reviews.Title: The only word to describe the S3200 is....SHOCKING
Reviews.Author: Smilin Sam
Reviews.Content: Not as in electrical shock; as in shockingly bad. At least indoors. Honestly...I don't even know where to begin. I SO (some pun intended) wanted to love this camera. Everything about it seemed perfect. The zoom range. The ergonomics. The pop up flash. The veiwfinder. The discounted price. The fact that it takes 4 standard AA batteries instead of proprietary, chip-encoded overpriced Li-Ions. I even got it in a kit with a really nice bag and a 4GB Fuji SDHC card. All for $179 at BJ's. I didn't even have to wait for it to arrive. I just drove there, bought it, and brought it home. And that's when things really took a definite turn for the worse.I had been using a Panasonic ZS8 that I'd gotten about a week ago, and I was sure, based on everything I wrote above, that I'd like the Fuji better. In my mind, I had already packed up the ZS8 and sent it back to Amazon, I was so sure I'd prefer the Fuji camera. (I think I even looked at my ZS8 somewhat disparagingly as I was getting ready to test the S3200.)(NOTE: I'd downloaded and read/skimmed the whole 144 page .pdf manual before I started taking any photos with the S3200, so it wasn't as if I was totally unfamiliar with its features.)Then I started taking some casual photos with the S3200, just as I'd done at first with the ZS8 (i.e. zooming in/out, trying photos with and without flash, trying custom settings in the P, S, & A modes, and comparing those shots to the ones taken in Auto mode, etc.). I was photographing the exact same things I'd been photographing with the ZS8, under the exact same conditions. I figured that was the best/fairest way to get an accurate comparsion. I had found the ZS8 to be tolerable-to-fair in low light/no flash settings, and having read the specs and the reviews, I was hoping that the S3200 would be at least as good, if not better.Well...as they say...we live in hope and die in despair. The results were just flat out abysmal. Forget about the photos being grainy. The ones without flash were just total garbage. And before you even ask...I tried every possible setting (except full Manual) to try to get the photos to look even halfway decent. I tried full auto, scene auto, natural light, natural light with flash, A mode, S mode, and P mode. To no avail. It was a total effort in futility. Even the flash shots, which APPEARED at first to be crisp and clear, all had what can best be described as an "over Photoshopped" look to them at full 100% magnification on the computer screen. You know what I mean, right? Where ALL the detail has been totally smoothed away. It might pass when you're trying for some kind of super smooth skin look in a glamour shot (but even then it tends to look artificial/unnatural), but for regular snapshots, from a supposedly good camera? I don't think so. I did manage to squeeze out somewhat better results in "P" mode, after hitting the proprietary/magic "F" button (don't tempt me, it wouldn't take much at this point), and lowering the ISO to 100. But again...it was way too little, way too late.There was also noticeable barrel distortion at the widest zoom setting (24mm focal length) on the S3200, whereas there was no such distortion from the identical shots taken with the ZS8 at the same 24mm focal length. So what good is it to have a 24mm super zoom lens that can't even take a simple, straight, undistorted picture? I didn't even bother taking the camera outdoors. If it can't take a decent picture indoors, what good is it?And as others have noted...it's really SLOOOOOOOOOWWWWWW to focus (if you can even GET it to focus). Forrest Gump slow. Molasses slow. Just gawd awful slow. It's even slow/sluggish when you're panning to compose the shot. It's like it's panning in semi-slow motion. It's not too slow to recycle after a flash shot. And it is pretty quick to zoom. But that's about it.I took around 100 shots, and maybe got 4 or 5 out of that bunch that were decent/useable. That's just very very sad. And as I stated at the outset...I REALLY wanted to like this camera. Fortunately, I didn't have to pay any shipping to get it here, and I won't have to pay any shipping to get it back.Now some folks might think that giving this camera 2 stars is harsh, because I admit I never even took it outside. But as far as I'm concerned, any camera that can't even take a decent indoor shot without it looking like it'd been Photoshopped to death (with flash), or taken with a black sock over the lens (without flash) is a below average performer, IMO. I will say that in kit form it came with a nice bag, and a nice 4gb Fuji card, and the price was more than reasonable, at least now that it's being discounted rather heavily. But to put your life's memories in the hands of this underperformer just doesn't make much sense to me.The big lesson clearly to be learned from all of this is that you cannot assume that just because a camera has a great spec sheet it's going to take great pictures. There's obviously a lot of stuff going on under that black plastic cover that determines the quality of the final photos; stuff that rarely if ever makes it to the spec sheets. And unfortunately, the Fuji S3200 totally misses the mark.As somewhat of an aside, the S3200 is definitely a smart little sucker. If you happen to turn the camera on without having first removed the lens cap, it'll give you a semi-polite, but stern warning: "Turn Off The Camera And Turn On Again". (At least it was polite enough not to say: "YOU LEFT THE LENS CAP ON, DUMMY!!") By the same token, it gives no indication whatsoever that the warning is related to the lens cap having been left on. When it first appeared I thought it was something much more serious. (Towards the end of the manual, in the "Warnings" section, it does mention that particular warning, but it does not say it has anything to do with the lens caps being on at the time the camera is turns on. I'm assuming that the two are connected since that warning only appeared when the lens cap left was on at the time the camera was turned on, and never appeared when the lens cap was off.) So now it's my turn to offer up a warning: "RUN DO NOT WALK TO THE NEAREST CUSTOMER SERVICE COUNTER AT BJ'S (or Amazon or wherever) TO RETURN THIS CAMERA!"(On a more jovial note...I would swear that my Panasonic ZS8 gave me a very smug, disparaging look as I was boxing up the S3200. If cameras could talk (and I think some of then can/do) my ZS8 would be saying: "NAH NAH NA NAH NAH!!!")

Reviews.Title: Too Grainy or Blurry
Reviews.Author: Gterrier3
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box I knew this camera was trouble. I took several pictures, under different light conditions and the gadgets, like 'fireworks" and "night". I have been taking photos with various 35mm's for 30 years. I know what to expect. All the photos were either blurry or very grainy...not good. I'm just going to use my 35's a little and a Nikon s6100. The Nikon, although little, can run circles around this thing. I don't believe in returning gifts, but I sent this one back.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: nstancil
Reviews.Content: Wow, I got this camera yesterday and had a great afternoon and early evening taking pictures of all kinds. I was very happy with my new camera. The features are great and the pictures are excellent. BUT, I had a problem with connecting it to a pc to download my pictures. Yes, I can still take out the card and download them through a card reader but let me finish my story..... I call support after trying multiple usb ports on 4 computers, tried another cord that works fine with another camera.....everything I could possibly think of. So support guy starts at the top of his list and he decides that it has to be a bad connector on the camera so he sends me over to repair for directions on how to get it repaired. They want me send it in for them to determine if it is covered under the 1 year warranty.1st I must pay to ship it to them. If the problem is not covered under warranty,or is deemed wear and tear, I will have to pay the repair fee and return shipping. (to get my brand new camera back). They did say however that if it was covered under warranty they would pay to express ship it back to me(please allow 6-8 weeks.....really....I then asked to speak to a manager and was put on hold for a couple of minutes until "someone else" came on the line to immediately explain their return policy that has been in place for over 30 years. They couldn't shut up which is where I got really turned off and is the reason I am writing this review. He said I was lucky that the camera still actually worked that most of the calls they get about this situation come from the connector somehow causing the camera to completely not work. He said that cables are overrated and card readers are the way to go so if I just go buy one, then all of my problems will be solved. He continued to belittle me by strongly suggesting that I caused the problem by trying to put the cable in the wrong way, " some people don't realize that it only goes in one way" Really..... again..., I finally thanked him for his time and politely hung up. I said all of that to say this. I like the camera, but the fact that "at least my camera still worked" (his words) the second day that I had it didn't give me any warm fuzzies about the overall quality of this camera. They didn't seem to care that the camera was one day old or the fact that I am a "first time" FUJI customer. Folks, this camera may be a good one at a good price but its not the only one I can assure you. I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER FUJI PRODUCT IN MY LIFE...Customer service still means something to me. I would suggest that you keep looking............

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Money
Reviews.Author: pete b
Reviews.Content: Fairly inexpensive.  Takes Awesome video and pictures.  Very user friendly.  24x zoom is great for a bridge camera.  Only drawback is battery life.  Easy to fix, carry extra set of batteries.  Have taken awesome pictures in China, The Phillipines, Mexico, NY City.  I really do love it

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: Jhon
Reviews.Content: This camera cannot be consider a super camera. It is good for the price but it could have a rech. battery.

Reviews.Title: great camera for dummies like me
Reviews.Author: Judith A Bryson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use - even I didn't have trouble - now if they just put an arm on cameras to stop PEOPLE from walking in front of me when I'm taking a movie or picture.  I also wish I could plug it in instead of battery only.  The cover on the batteries looks like a future problem..not fast to open/close.

Reviews.Title: great purchase
Reviews.Author: butterbean76
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for my fiance for her Christmas present, with all of the choices for cameras out there I wanted to get one that was not only affordable but a great product, let me tell you this was it. We both couldn't be happier with this camera. 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: S3200 FinePix Review
Reviews.Author: Darkins
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a gift for Christmas after showing an interest in photography. I was upgrading from a compact Nikon CoolPix L18 that was just about only good for macro shots.First, I'd like to say that this bridge camera really helped me get used to full manual mode. While the SR-Auto mode works well in some situations, photos may come out noisy/grainy.The camera can't possibly tell you everything in order to take the shot YOU want. Take some time to learn about aperture,shutter speed, and ISO levels and once venture past SR-Auto mode you'll start to see great results.Focus doesn't work as well as a DSLR especially since there is no manual focus option. Continuous shooting works as described, but the Panorama mode doesn't always stitch the shoots together correctly. I prefer to manually stitch in a photo processing application on my computer but, you can still take quality panoramas using the cameras stitching.I'd recommend this for a photographer of any age that is on a budget, or doesn't quite want to take a step up into the DSLR-level cameras just yet. It is well worth the price and I'm quite proud of the quality of pictures I've taken with it.For some photo examples, check out [...]

Reviews.Title: Thanks
Reviews.Author: BROFDINO
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Fujifilm S3200 from Beachcamera. Perfect condition, working great and it arrived much sooner than expected.Thanks for the great service,Mike

Reviews.Title: Lack of a thread mount for filters
Reviews.Author: Joann Lewis "Bookwizards"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera several months ago and just noticed that there is no provision to add screw mount filters like a UV or polarizing filter. I did not check at the time but at this price point I would have expected this ability on a mid range bridge camera. I bought this as a travel camera so I would not need to carry three lenses and a camera around. I really liked the polarizing filters ability to give deep blue skys and white fluffy clouds in landscape shots. I had wanted to add a UV filter as protection but will have to do without these. Is it a good camera yes, would I have looked for another camera in order to get a filter mount Yes. I wanted a camera that used AA batteries after a charger for a lithium battery pack failed while in England for 3 months backpacking and traveling by bus a replacement was a 3 week wait and it would have cost over 100 GBP. Fortunatley I had a short zoom point and shoot that used AA batteries but I lost the ability for wide angle shots a necessity with the narrow streets of London and english villages. AA batteries are available everywhere inexpensivley. If I travel with a DSLR I will take a back up charger and a half dozen battery packs. I will be buying something else before my next trip in 2013 that has a filter screw mount.

Reviews.Title: Really bad focusing issues; long pause between taking photos
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Dockett
Reviews.Content: I have had the previous version of this model camera, which had worked fine for 2 1/2 years now.  Decided to upgrade to more megapixels and a longer zoom lens.  What a disappointment.  The auto focus took about 10 seconds to lock onto anything and snap a photo, and about 1/3 of the photos were "out of focus" and blurry.  Also, on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day, I missed so many candid photos because it took about 10 seconds to compose a photo; and again about 1/3 of the photos were out of focus.  There is no manual focus over ride.  I will have to assume the camera is defective, and have returned it.  Also, compared to this camera's predecssor from 2 1/2 years ago, it is clearly being made with much cheaper materials.  I will search for a different brand, make and model of camera in the future.  I do not reecommed this camera.

Reviews.Title: Highly disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Stoudt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with really high hopes, but unfortunately, I was gravely disappointed. As someone who has extensive knowledge of photography, I was excited when I read the specs of what this camera could potentially do for the rather low price. But, you get what you pay for. The pictures were very grainy, even when I changed the ISO to a lower setting, the pictures were of very low quality.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Works great and takes nice pictures.  Has some nice features.  A little bulky, compared to other cameras, but overall very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good "GO-BETWEEN"
Reviews.Author: RONALD GRAYBEAL
Reviews.Content: Looking for a SLR-D but a little pricy? S3200 fits in this niche!! Eye level viewer or LCD screen!! Bright sunny days make critical photography on  any LCD screen a problem!! Camera has a list of features you want in a SLR-D not to mention a lens quality above average but with Wide-Angle to Max Tele very impressive!!!! You won't need an interchangeable lens......

Reviews.Title: It's an excellent camera.
Reviews.Author: Julian B. Booth
Reviews.Content: Like the way it operates.  Does almost everything I want it to do.  Works superbly.  Would recommend it to any camera lover who wants a practical and very useful camera.

Reviews.Title: Zoom is a big plus
Reviews.Author: to90run "Baton"
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the powerful optical zoom. However, for the price(at the time) I would expect better quality pictures, especially indoor.

Reviews.Title: this camera is a lemon
Reviews.Author: Typical Citizen "Tim"
Reviews.Content: at first it worked great, then after the first month with the camera i noticed that it took longer and longer to take another picture. now literally it takes more than 2 mins to take another shot. the flash quit working as well. the camera was kept in its case except for when in use and was never dropped or exposed to water..............i usually do not give bad reviews, but this camera earned it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Rae Ann Gundelfinger
Reviews.Content: More features than I expected! Panaramic photos and much more. It's like having a photo shop built right into the camera!

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Darryl Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera is priced well, but the video quality just doesn't compare to two of my brothers' Sony cameras, but the Sony cameras cost more than twice as much!

Reviews.Title: FinePix S3200
Reviews.Author: casaoro
Reviews.Content: replacement for a similar camera lost (in a cab) in Morelia. thought about a DSLR , but liked the simplicity of a "range finder" with automatic focusing. liked the features and have used it significantly

Reviews.Title: Easy and Enjoyable
Reviews.Author: Ellen Day
Reviews.Content: This has been the best buy for such a wonderful camera. My husband and I both love the ease of use

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Was a gift for my wife for the holidays she loved everything about it thank you for the great product

Reviews.Title: Ver good
Reviews.Author: Domingo Vegas
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, although I would have liked a more professional for an amateur is an excellent camera, easy to operate

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality and performance for the price of a point-and-shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: Gene Davis
Reviews.Content: I am still learning about many of the features of my camera, but so far I'm impressed with its performance and versatility.  I do wish, though, that Fuji would go the extra mile and include a printed owner's guide with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Bought a Nikon...
Reviews.Author: Midnightgreen
Reviews.Content: Recently Bought a Nikon.  Cost around the same price but it had awful 26x zoom with blurry pictures.  Won't be purchasing an Nikon anymore.  Like this one better.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for almost anyone, just not kids.
Reviews.Author: Heike.
Reviews.Content: I love it, love it, love it. I got this for $165 hoping it would be worth the money. IT WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY!! I love the camera, and here's why: I figuered out how to use it in ten minutes, it has really high quality pis, even at close up, or full zoom, and in general easy to use.

Reviews.Title: good machine but
Reviews.Author: luis gabriel oviedo bonilla
Reviews.Content: this is a good machine but the flash is not strong what i was spected, and the no have a support for extra flash

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: tgoati
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. It takes very nice photos and the best videos I have ever taken. Great deal too!

Reviews.Title: FUJIFILM FINEPIX S3200
Reviews.Author: Blas
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product, really meets my expectations. I am very happy with this purchase can not find the true master in negative aspect.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S3200 14 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me this camera for Christmas and I love it.  I had previous had a Canon 35mm EOS and was a hesitant digital camera user because I hated how they felt in my hands.  I tried this camera out right after Christmas during a business trip to San Diego and the camera was easy to use, lightweight, and took amazing photographs!  Guess I won't have to worry about buying film anymore!I do want to add for the new digital camera user, I did actually use the "user's guide" on a couple of the settings so I could understand how to best use them. Otherwise, it was a very simple camera to use and start right out taking photos.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen McPherson
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use and great shots even for a true amateur as I. It allows me to keep a steady grip for non-blurry shots. Always had difficulty with this with the pocket sized point and shoot type. Find I prefer to use the view finder for framing pictures. Can't wait to use it at the beach for sunset shots in Ft. Myers.

Reviews.Title: So simple, yet so frustrating
Reviews.Author: Jack R. Carlson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for work and was trying it out at home and fell in love with it UNTIL I kept getting the message "Turn the camera off and back on".  I have been trying for two weeks to figure out what I was doing wrong because when it did work, it was fabulous - then I read in another review that someone had figured out that the message appears when the lens cap has not been removed!  Could it really have been that simple?  Appearently it was because have not had a problem since - only wish the message would have said "remove lens cap".  The manual gave me no clue at all what I was doing wrong - I was very close to returning an other wise great camera for the price, had it not been for your reviews - thanks Amazon for allowing us all to learn!

Reviews.Title: Not my cup of tea
Reviews.Author: craig nicol
Reviews.Content: This was to replace an older, similar Fuji camera but... this one struck a wrong note from the first. It's heavy and "feature-creep" loaded it up with all kinds of marginally useful "new" capabilities while stuff I enjoyed on my old Fuji was either buried or absent. -Weight -size -loss of favored features, -difficult battery/SD cover latch, -goofy splatter-paint finish. I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: fujifilm FinePix S3200
Reviews.Author: OkieinMoore
Reviews.Content: Got this camera on sale during the black friday craziness.  the camera take great pics and it is very easy to use.  It is heavier than i would have thought but that is from the optical lens.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: trywaitnow
Reviews.Content: After just a few days of use, it is far superior to the Minolta DiMage z20 it is replacing.  Low light shots without using flash are amazing. Navigating the My Fine Pix Studio download to computer program is the only drawback so far, way too involved and confusing.  But other than that, I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: NICE
Reviews.Author: Dave Hartigan
Reviews.Content: This is a camera with many features and I'll have to say one of the best I have even owned.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: bookz123
Reviews.Content: I've been taking pics with this camera and have begun trying to start photography on the side and thnx to this camera (and photoshop), I've already gotten some clients who want me to do a photoshoot for them!

Reviews.Title: Fuji FinePix Camera
Reviews.Author: bonbon
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying the camera.  I wanted the ability to be able to set my own controls and this camera is allowing me to do that.  The picture quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: Mes photos
Reviews.Content: I own a Fuji PixS1500 and got wonderful results.I  bought the S3200 before taking a trip to Niagara Falls, because of the 24X zoom.  I must admit that this is a good camera; all of my pictures came out great, sharp and beautiful colors,  except the ones taken during the firework - I really did not read the manual.  However, I had to deal with the battery door being hard to lock.  Also on a couple of occasions I got the "read error" while reviewing the pictures. This also happened with the S1500. Could be a Fujifilm FinePix affair. I would not hesitate to recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Defective camera and defective support...
Reviews.Author: Koz
Reviews.Content: I'm no photographer and couldn't tell you one whit about what makes a good picture and what makes a good camera.  Nevertheless I needed a camera to document those family vacations and embarrassing family events.  The FinePix S3200 promised to deliver features beyond my artistic capabilities at an acceptable price point.  It arrived in March 2011 and seemed to deliver.  The features were easy to use and the pictures looked great!Then everything went horribly wrong!After testing the camera and determining that it functioned as advertised I packed it back up in its box and placed it in the closet until it would be needed.  Eight months later I pulled it out of the box so that a friend could grab some candid photos at our wedding.  Upon powering the camera on the view screen promptly advised that it be turned off.  After following this advice a few times I decided to declare shenanigans and do the usual troubleshooting.  Remove the lens cover, check.  Remove batteries, check.  Remove memory card, check...Then I called their support department. <sarcasm> This guy was a genius, and so polite too.</sarcasm>.  Here's what he had me do:  Remove the lens cover.When that extensive troubleshooting failed to resolve the problem he advised that I contact their repair department.  Evidently he can't setup a repair for me and he can't transfer me to their repair department because the repair department is only open Monday through Friday.I contacted the repair department and here's the gist of what they said:  "[just ship it to us with a letter and we'll call you back]."  Glad I had to call for this info.  Oh, and in case you're wondering how you proved you talked to anyone - you don't.  You just ship that bad boy off to a black hole somewhere and hope for the best.  You've already dropped three bones on this defective doodad so its not like you stand to lose more, right?The camera was delivered to FujiFilm's repair center 1.5 weeks ago and no call.  So I picked up the phone and dialed up that black hole.  They were unable to find the package.  Color me surprised.  The attendant at the black hole advised me that they are behind on their camera repairs, so it could just be that they have not yet scanned it into their system.  <sarcasm> Until now I was unaware that they had a system </sarcasm>So there you go.. Breaks in less than 15 hours of use.  Goes to a black hole for repairs.  May or may not ever be seen again.  <sarcasm> Great product </sarcasm>

Reviews.Title: Avoid FUJI cameras! The USB port is not covered by warranty
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Fuji cameras within the past year. This one has worked well. However, I purchased the SL300 in January. The second time I used the USB port, it was extremely difficult to insert the cable. On the third try, it was impossible. I always check the curvature to make sure I'm inserting the cable correctly. I have owned over 12 digital cameras (including ones purchased for family members)and have never had one with a bad USB port before.  Here's the kicker: Three months into the warranty, I sent the camera to Fuji for repair only to be told that it will cost $150.00 to repair the USB port. That's what I paid for the camera, so clearly they are insane. But what troubles me is that the USB port IS NOT COVERED by the warranty. Who makes a camera and doesn't cover essential parts?  I will NEVER buy another Fuji camera because I don't like being swindled. Going back to other brands (like Kodak and Olympus) that have given me superior performance.  I am placing this notice on both cameras because consumers should know that Fuji does not stand behind its products.

Reviews.Title: Good, but evil.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Moore
Reviews.Content: The camera cam out great, unfortunately,  with Fujifilm, you have to order the memory card separetly, which sucks. The memory card isn't cheap either.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S3200: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Gordon P. Jones
Reviews.Content: The S3200 arrived ahead of time, in the manufacturers box, and in perfect condition.  It was easy to use right out of the box.  However, it has tons of features that we haven't even explored yet.  If you want to see photos taken with the S3200, go to [...].

Reviews.Title: What's with the double A batteries?
Reviews.Author: Ouijahz "Ouijahz"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera BUT I spend $$$$ replacing AA batteries. I love Fuji cameras but will never buy another one that does not include rechargeable battery. The camera is a battery suck as it is and will easily go through 6-8  batteries on a vacation weekend..and that's if you buy expensive lithium ones.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: celeste55
Reviews.Content: I'm very new to photography as a hobby, and so far this camera has been an affordable, high-quality option for me to learn with.  Still haven't quite figured out all the manual functions, but the auto functions work well!

Reviews.Title: NEW FUJI CAM FOR NEW AMATEUR PHOTOGRAPHER...
Reviews.Author: sergio paschoalon
Reviews.Content: I love my new Cam!!!The only thing that I had "trouble", is that setting process is not so easy, for amateur users like me...heheheheZoom is spetacular...HD Video is amazing!Talking about SIZE, this model is not so small if comparing to Sony HX1, but is ok.In general, I have no concern in indicating that camera!!!

Reviews.Title: only if you are a complete beginner to digital
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: Well, I got it and the flash doesn't work. Sending it back asap, and going back to film only.The pictures turn out alright, but nothing that I would want to put in a gallery. If you want digital, but aren't new to taking photographs go for a canon, this is a waste. If you're new to it and want a nice point and shoot, this will be perfectly adequate.So back to my SLR and instant.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: alfred929
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera - afterall, it's 14 MP and 24X.  Got it and tried it, and the quality of the pictures is just plain terrible.  My old iPhone camera takes better picture than this.

Reviews.Title: Only because price & features!
Reviews.Author: M Molina
Reviews.Content: This purchase replaces a FinePix S700 camera I got late 2007. I replaced it with this modelbecause of its 1)combination of price and features,  2) similar in operation to S700 with new added functions. Otherwise, the FujiFilm support offered (web, phone and camera software) is really not good, but the camera is good enough for 3 years use and then get a new one if the old one breaks (repair is not an option anymore this days!).In summary, for the price, you'll be ok traveling and if broken you can replace with a newer model, the camera has some nice features and it is easy to use and get good pictures.

ProductInfo.Features:
14 million effective pixels; 1/2.3 inch CCD sensor; 24x optical zoom lens plus approx 6.7x digital zoom
3.0 inch color TFT LCD monitor plus electronic viewfinder; HD MPEG4 movie 720p with sound
6 scene SR AUTO recognition; Motion Panorama mode with auto stitch; Auto image rotation in playback
Dual image stabilization; Face and Blink Detection; Smile and Shoot mode; Auto red-eye removal; Tracking auto focus
USB 2.0 High-speed; HDMI mini connector; Video output NTSC / PAL selectable; SD/SDHC memory card slot (card NOT included)
14-megapixel CCD sensor; 24x wide-angle optical zoom lens
Motion Panorama shooting mode
720p HD movie capture; mini-HDMI output
Easy upload to Facebook and YouTube
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix S3200 14 MP Digital Camera with Fujinon 24x Super Wide Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD
